clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Teach-back in Knee Replacement Discussion

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to analyze how using the teach-back communication technique can improve patient:provider communication surrounding the discussion of knee replacement options, specifically Total Knee Arthroplasty(TKA) or a Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty(UKA). Orthopedic residents, fellows, physician assistants, and attendings that agree to participate will be consented and patients that have a clinical indication for a TKA and a UKA will be recruited from participating providers clinical schedules. Patient:provider interactions will be recorded and then the providers will attend a 1 hour education lecture about how to use teach-back. After attending the lecture, additional patient:provider interactions will be recorded and analyzed via a qualitative approach. Additionally, providers will participate in a semi-structured interview to capture their perceptions of teach-back and what challenges and benefits they may derive from using it.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of discussion with patient, 20 minutes
primary_outcome.description: We will assess this outcome directly from audio-recorded conversations. The transcript will be initially coded for talk related to knee replacement. After this a coding scheme will be developed that captures the average length of provider utterance without asking a question or an interruption from a patient

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of discussion with patient, 20 minutes
primary_outcome.description: This outcome will also be assessed from audio-recorded conversations. The transcript will be initially coded for talk related to knee replacement and then the coding scheme will compare how often and how long patients talk compared to provider talking.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of semi-structured interview, one hour
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome will be assessed via semi-structured interviews.

secondary_outcome.measure: Providers belief of future use of teach-back
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of semi-structured interview, one hour
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome will be assessed via the semi-structured interview

arm_group.description: A teach-back lesson will be provided to physician participants (Teach-Back Group), who are participating in discussions with patients regarding total knee replacements versus partial knee replacements.

intervention.description: A teach-back lesson will be given to providers (teach-back group) who commonly discuss total versus partial knee replacement options with patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria (Patient Participants):
- Age 18 years and older
- Clinical indication for either a TKA or UKA
Exclusion Criteria (Patient Participants):
- Non-English speaking
- Minors or non-consenting other individuals (spouses, friends, family members, children) in the patient room during the clinical visit
Inclusion Criteria (Provider Participants)
- Age 18 years and older
- A resident, fellow, physician assistant, or attending in the Duke Department of Orthopaedic Surgery
- A provider who is involved in the treatment of individuals requiring a TKA or UKA
